topics.title: IPMDAR Implementation Planning
topics.content:
Implementing IPMDAR on a program requires comprehensive planning to ensure compliance and maximize value. Key implementation planning elements include:

1. Requirements Analysis: Understanding which IPMDAR components apply to the specific contract
2. Tailoring Assessment: Identifying appropriate tailoring options based on program size and complexity
3. System Evaluation: Assessing existing systems and tools for IPMDAR data collection and reporting
4. Resource Planning: Identifying required personnel, skills, and training needs
5. Implementation Schedule: Developing a phased approach to IPMDAR implementation

Successful implementation planning ensures that IPMDAR becomes an effective program management tool rather than just a compliance exercise.
learning_objectives: Develop a comprehensive IPMDAR implementation plan
Identify appropriate resources and timeline for implementation
Assess system and process requirements for effective IPMDAR reporting

topics.title: IPMDAR Contract Requirements Integration
topics.content:
Integrating IPMDAR requirements into contracts requires careful attention to detail in procurement documents. Key considerations include:

1. Data Item Descriptions (DIDs): Properly citing and tailoring IPMDAR DIDs
2. Contract Data Requirements Lists (CDRLs): Developing appropriate CDRLs with clear delivery schedules
3. Statement of Work (SOW) Requirements: Ensuring SOW language supports IPMDAR implementation
4. Evaluation Criteria: Including IPMDAR capabilities in source selection criteria when appropriate

Proper contractual integration of IPMDAR requirements establishes clear expectations and ensures the government receives the data needed for effective program oversight.
learning_objectives: Develop properly tailored IPMDAR contract requirements
Create appropriate CDRLs for IPMDAR deliverables
Incorporate IPMDAR requirements into procurement documents

topics.title: Work Breakdown Structure Development
topics.content:
The Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) is the foundation for IPMDAR reporting, organizing program work into a hierarchical structure. Effective WBS development includes:

1. Product-Oriented Decomposition: Breaking the program into deliverable-focused elements
2. Appropriate Level of Detail: Decomposing to the level needed for effective management
3. WBS Dictionary: Documenting the scope of each WBS element
4. MIL-STD-881 Compliance: Ensuring alignment with DoD WBS standards

A well-designed WBS enables accurate performance measurement and reporting, providing a consistent structure for IPMDAR data.
learning_objectives: Develop a compliant program WBS for IPMDAR reporting
Apply MIL-STD-881 guidance to WBS development

topics.title: Integrated Baseline Review (IBR) Process
topics.content:
The Integrated Baseline Review (IBR) is a critical process for validating the Performance Measurement Baseline (PMB) that forms the foundation of IPMDAR reporting. Key IBR elements include:

1. Pre-IBR Preparation: Data collection, artifact review, and team training
2. IBR Execution: Discussions with Control Account Managers (CAMs) and technical leads
3. Risk Identification: Documenting technical, schedule, and cost risks in the baseline
4. Action Item Tracking: Documenting and tracking findings until closure

A thorough IBR ensures that the baseline is realistic, comprehensive, and provides a valid reference point for IPMDAR performance reporting.
learning_objectives: Plan and execute an effective Integrated Baseline Review
Assess the quality and completeness of a Performance Measurement Baseline
Identify and document baseline risks for monitoring
